meanings.definition: Separate grain from (a plant) by beating
meanings.sent1: The farmer was threshing the wheat to separate the seeds from the stalks.
meanings.sent2: They used a tool for threshing the rice to get the grains ready for cooking.
meanings.sent3: The chickens thought the farmer was playing a game when he started threshing the corn.
meanings.sent4: The sound of threshing echoed through the fields, like a rhythmic drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The sun beat down on the workers as they continued threshing the barley under the clear sky.

meanings.definition: Beat (grain) with a machine or flail to separate the grain from the straw
meanings.sent1: The old-fashioned method of threshing involved using a flail to separate the wheat kernels.
meanings.sent2: The farmers brought out the threshing machine to quickly process the harvested oats.
meanings.sent3: The noisy threshing machine startled the birds nearby, causing them to fly away in a flurry.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic thud of the flail against the wheat created a soothing sound during threshing.
meanings.sent5: The straw flew in all directions as the machine worked tirelessly at threshing the barley.
